Package de.thm.oop.chat.base.server

Class BasicTHMChatServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.thm.oop.chat.base.server.BasicTHMChatServer
  • public class BasicTHMChatServer
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides basic functionality to communicate with the THM Chat Server.
    Author:
    Dominik Schultes

    • Method Detail

      • sendTextMessage

        public void sendTextMessage​(java.lang.String username,
                            java.lang.String password,
                            java.lang.String receiver,
                            java.lang.String text)
                     throws java.io.IOException,
                            java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Sends a text message.
        Parameters:
        username - the own username.
        password - the own password.
        receiver - the username of the receiver.
        text - the message body. Characters '|', '\n', and '\r' are automatically removed.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if a network problem occurs or the server reports an error (e.g. due to a wrong username/password).
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given arguments are null.

      • sendImageMessage

        public void sendImageMessage​(java.lang.String username,
                             java.lang.String password,
                             java.lang.String receiver,
                             java.lang.String mimeType,
                             java.io.InputStream imageData)
                      throws java.io.IOException,
                             java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Sends an image message.
        Parameters:
        username - the own username.
        password - the own password.
        receiver - the username of the receiver.
        mimeType - the MIME type of the image.
        imageData - an InputStream providing the image data. Note that after this operation, the stream is closed and cannot be reused.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if a network problem occurs or the server reports an error (e.g. due to a wrong username/password).
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given arguments are null.

      • getUsers

        public java.lang.String[] getUsers​(java.lang.String username,
                                   java.lang.String password)
                            throws java.io.IOException,
                                   java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Returns a list of all registered users.
        Parameters:
        username - the own username.
        password - the own password.
        Returns:
        a String array containing all usernames.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if a network problem occurs or the server reports an error (e.g. due to a wrong username/password).
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given arguments are null.

      • getMostRecentMessages

        public java.lang.String[] getMostRecentMessages​(java.lang.String username,
                                                java.lang.String password)
                                         throws java.io.IOException,
                                                java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Returns a list of the most recent 100 messages sent or received.
        Parameters:
        username - the own username.
        password - the own password.
        Returns:
        a String array containing all messages. Each message consists of several parts separated by '|':
        id | timestamp | direction ("in" or "out") | chat partner (sender/receiver) | message type ("txt" or "img") | ...
        in case of a text message, the final part is the message body
        in case of an image message, there are three furhter parts: MIME type | size | URL where the image can be retrieved
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if a network problem occurs or the server reports an error (e.g. due to a wrong username/password).
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given arguments are null.

      • getMessages

        public java.lang.String[] getMessages​(java.lang.String username,
                                      java.lang.String password,
                                      long newerThan)
                               throws java.io.IOException,
                                      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Returns a list of all messages sent or received that are newer than the given message id.
        Parameters:
        username - the own username.
        password - the own password.
        newerThan - a message id (typically the maximum of all message ids that have been fetched so far)
        Returns:
        a String array containing all messages. Each message consists of several parts separated by '|':
        id | timestamp | direction ("in" or "out") | chat partner (sender/receiver) | message type ("txt" or "img") | ...
        in case of a text message, the final part is the message body
        in case of an image message, there are three furhter parts: MIME type | size | URL where the image can be retrieved
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if a network problem occurs or the server reports an error (e.g. due to a wrong username/password).
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given arguments are null.
